bibl.title: Brothers or Lovers? A New Reading of the "Tondo of the Two Brothers".
bibl.note: Cairo, Egyptian Museum, Cat. Gén. 33267. Portrait of 2 young men painted on a circular wooden panel (Albert Gayet's excavation at Antinoopolis, 1898/1899). - Argues that the tondo, identified as portrait of 2 brothers, can plausibly be read as a portrait of 2 male lovers.
bibl.seg: HAECKL Anne E., Brothers or Lovers? A New Reading of the "Tondo of the Two Brothers".

Cairo, Egyptian Museum, Cat. Gén. 33267. Portrait of 2 young men painted on a circular wooden panel (Albert Gayet's excavation at Antinoopolis, 1898/1899). - Argues that the tondo, identified as portrait of 2 brothers, can plausibly be read as a portrait of 2 male lovers.
